metadata.name: LAX Landing Practice
metadata.description: Guided approach and landing at Los Angeles International Airport

_quest.initialMsg: Approach LAX Runway 25L — reduce throttle, begin descent
_quest.initialHint: Nose down gently (S/Down). Keep wings level. Follow the approach path.

waypoints.name: DESCENT
waypoints.msg: Begin descent. Reduce throttle to 30%, nose down gently.
waypoints.hint: Target -3° glide angle. Speed should decrease naturally.

waypoints.name: 10 MILE
waypoints.msg: 10 miles out. Slow below 150 m/s. Continue descent.
waypoints.hint: Reduce throttle further. You should be passing through ~1500m.

waypoints.name: CONFIGURE
waypoints.msg: Deploy landing gear (G). Gear drag helps slow you down.
waypoints.hint: Should be ~1000m altitude. Gear creates drag — helps slow down.

waypoints.name: 5 MILE
waypoints.msg: Deploy flaps (F). Slow to 80-100 m/s approach speed.
waypoints.hint: Flaps give extra lift at low speed. Keep descending smoothly.

waypoints.name: FINAL
waypoints.msg: On final approach. Runway ahead — hold glidepath steady.
waypoints.hint: Below 100 m/s, gear & flaps down. Small throttle adjustments.

waypoints.name: THRESHOLD
waypoints.msg: Touchdown zone! Idle throttle, flare nose up, hold B to brake.
waypoints.hint: Speed < 120, gear down, wings level = safe landing.

milestones.msg: GEAR DOWN — drag increasing, slowing naturally.
50m — FLARE! Nose up gently, idle throttle.
TOUCHDOWN! Hold B to brake. Well done!
FULL STOP — LANDING COMPLETE! You've mastered the approach!
